meanings.definition: To spread out or distribute widely.
meanings.sent1: She was dispreading the seeds across the field.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was dispreading the crayons on the table for the students.
meanings.sent3: The magician dispread the cards in a surprising pattern.
meanings.sent4: The news of the treasure hunt dispread quickly throughout the town.
meanings.sent5: The chef dispread the icing on the cake with precision.

meanings.sent1: The detective dispread the evidence to the jury.
meanings.sent2: The author dispread the secret in the final chapter of the book.
meanings.sent3: The cat dispread its hiding spot by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise dispread the colors across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The map dispread the location of the hidden treasure.

meanings.sent1: The wind dispread the leaves all over the yard.
meanings.sent2: The child dispread the toys around the room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel dispread the nuts from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks dispread light and color in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The rain dispread droplets on the window pane.
